intro: Chorizanthe thurberi, commonly known as Thurber's choris, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and have a rough texture, and it produces small, dry fruits that contain seeds. It is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats.
